  sgcool_label_text: A pair of gold and enamelled elephant head bangles
 decorated with precious stones
 and exquisite pink enamelling on the inside of the shank.\r\nThis object shows the taste for luxury objects in Northern India in the 19th century. In Mughal India there was a great revival in the art of rock crystal carving
 and Mughal craftsmen reached new heights of technical virtuosity especially during the reign of Shah Jahan (1628-1658). The motifs in the gem work and enamelling of flowers
 plants
 scrolling vines and animal forms allude to paradise gardens on earth. It would have been highly prized and made for a privileged few.\r\n

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
A pair of gold and enamelled elephant head bangles, decorated with precious stones, and exquisite pink enamelling on the inside of the shank.
This object shows the taste for luxury objects in Northern India in the 19th century. In Mughal India there was a great revival in the art of rock crystal carving, and Mughal craftsmen reached new heights of technical virtuosity especially during the reign of Shah Jahan (1628-1658). The motifs in the gem work and enamelling of flowers, plants, scrolling vines and animal forms allude to paradise gardens on earth. It would have been highly prized and made for a privileged few.
